LanguageData.NeedSawmillDesc: Ye need some kind o' sawmill t' chop logs into more versatile wood planks.\n\nBuild a HAND SAWMILL or an ELECTRIC SAWMILL.
LanguageData.ColonistsNeedRescueDesc:
These colonists be incapacitated on th' ground:

{0}
Send another colonist t' rescue them and carry them aft t' bed.

(To rescue, select another colonist, then right click on th' victim 'n select Rescue.
LanguageData.BuildARoomDesc: A room be composed 'o separate wall pieces wit' a door.\n\nUse t' ARCHITECT menu at t' bottom port o' t' screen t' designate where you want thin's built. Once you designate somethin' t' be built, your colonists will do t' work when they can.
LanguageData.NeedDefensesDesc:
Ye've be here some time 'n have probably been seen. Scurvy pirate raids gunna start soon.

Ye should prepare defenses.

Build some turrets.
LanguageData.NeedMinerDesc: You have designated some rocks to be mined, but no colonist has the Mining work type.\n\nAssign a colonist the Mining work type.
LanguageData.NeedWardenDesc: Ye have a prisoner, but no colonist has th' Warden work type.\n\nAssign a colonist th' Warden work type.
LanguageData.LowFoodDesc: Ye only have {0} nutrition worth 'o food in storage. 'tis be dangerously low.\n\nGrow, buy, find, or murder some food.
LanguageData.NeedColonistBedsDesc:
Ye have more colonists than ye have colonist beds. Someone gunna lack a place to sleep.

Either make more beds, or change a prisoner bed to a colonist bed.

If ye have no resources, sleepin' spots be free 'n can be placed instantly.
LanguageData.HunterLacksWeaponDesc: A colonist be assigned as a hunter but has no weapon. They will not hunt 'til they be carryin' a weapon.\n\nTo reduce injury, we recommend givin' them a ranged weapon.
LanguageData.NeedFoodHopperDesc:
Ye have a nutrient dispenser wit' no hopper next to it.

To work, paste dispensers must draw from an adjacent hopper filled wit' raw food.

Build a hopper adjacent to th' dispenser.
LanguageData.NeedMealSourceDesc:
You have no way of preparing proper meals from raw food.

Build a nutrient paste dispenser or a cook stove.

(It cannot be in a prison cell, otherwise colonists cannot use it.)
LanguageData.NeedHomeRegionDesc: You need to define a HOME REGION where your colonists will clean, extinguish fires, and repair things.\n\nDefine a home region using the ZONES section of the ARCHITECT menu.
LanguageData.NeedBatteriesDesc: You only have solar generators and no batteries. This means you'll lose power every time the sun goes down.\n\nBuild a battery or two to get you through the night.
LanguageData.NoTradingCapacityDesc: You have no way of trading with passing ships.\n\nBuild a comms console.
LanguageData.BrawlerHasRangedWeaponDesc: One of your colonists has the Brawler personality trait, but is carrying a ranged weapon. This will make them very unhappy.
LanguageData.ShieldUserHasRangedWeaponDesc: One of your colonists has a personal shield and is carrying a ranged weapon. They will not be able to fire their weapon through the shield (except at targets who are already touching them).
LanguageData.NeedResearchProjectDesc: You have the equipment to do research but have not selected a project.\n\nOpen the research menu and select a project.
LanguageData.NeedDumpDesc: You have marked {0} to be hauled, but the colonists have nowhere to take it.\n\nDesignate a stockpile and set its storage settings to accept {0}.
LanguageData.NeedGraveDesc: There is a dead body laying on the ground and nowhere for your colonists to take it.\n\nBuild a grave or a dumping zone and set their storage settings.
LanguageData.ColonistNeedsTreatmentDesc:
These colonists need medical treatment. Without it, they may die of their wounds, or their wounds may become permanent.

{0}
Treat them by sending them to a medical bed.

(First, assign a medical bed by selecting it and toggling it into a medical bed. Then, select the wounded colonists and right-click on the medical bed to make them a patient.)
LanguageData.FireInHomeRegionDesc: There is a fire in the home region.

NoMedicineDesc: You have no medicine left in storage.\n\nBuy more medicine from traders.
HunterHasShieldAndRangedWeaponDesc: One of your hunters is using a ranged weapon and wearing a shield belt which prevents shooting at range.\n\nThey won't be able to hunt unless the shield is removed.
HunterHasShieldAndRangedWeapon: Hunter has shield and ranged weapon
LowMedicineDesc: You only have {0} medications left in storage.\n\nBuy more medicine from traders.
NeedWarmClothesDesc1All: All of your colonists will lack warm clothes when the cold season comes.
AlertTatteredApparelDesc:
These colonists are wearing tattered apparel, which is making them sad:

{0}
Get them some apparel that isn't so badly damaged.

You can tailor apparel at a tailoring table, or buy it from traders.
ImmobileCaravanDesc: One of your caravans is immobile because it carries too much.\n\nYou can make the caravan mobile again by abandoning some items in the ITEMS tab.
NeedWarmClothesDesc1: At least {0} of your colonists will lack warm clothes when the cold season comes.
NeedWarmClothesDesc2: The outdoor temperature is going to reach {0}.\n\nYou can tailor warm clothes at the tailoring bench, or buy them from traders.
AlertUnhappyNudityDesc:
These colonists are nude and not happy about it:

{0}
Get them some clothes.

You can tailor apparel at a tailoring table, or buy it from traders.
FireInHomeAreaDesc: There is a fire in the home area.
BreakRiskMinorDesc: These colonists are in a poor mood and may have a minor mental break at any time:\n\n{0}
NeedJoySourceDesc: Your colonists need to fulfill their joy need, but you haven't built any joy sources.\n\nHelp them by building a horseshoes pin, chess table, or other joy source.
BreakRiskMajorDesc: These colonists are in a very poor mood and may have a major mental break at any time:\n\n{0}
BreakRiskExtremeDesc: These colonists are critically stressed and may have an extreme (and possibly violent) mental break at any moment:\n\n{0}
BreakRiskDescEnding: Check these colonists' Needs tab to see what's bothering them.\n\nTo make colonists feel better, you can do things like make them fancy meals, give them more joy hours per day and nicer joy objects, place them in beautiful environments, have them drink and smoke, and much more.
BilliardsNeedsSpaceDesc: One of your billiards table is adjacent to an obstruction that will prevent colonists from using it.\n\nA billiards table needs clear space around it on all sides to be usable.
